tagDescription: Frederic Gray: Informs of partnership with S.T. Morse under the name of Gray & Morse.
R.W. Weston: Profit on last voyage to China.
Wm. Gooding to Hon. J. Davis - re charges against him and the Boston Committee, by Chas. Oakley, &c.
Jos. Hamm: Sentiments in Texas on political future. Encloses newspaper extract on the subject.

D. Webster to J. Bates - Facts relating to the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal - Also letter marked Private re agent in England for negotiating Bonds - memo signed T.B. re Webster's letter - Also pamphlet - Special Report of President and Directors of Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. 29 April 1845.- transferred to Printed Documents under date 30 July 1845
Wm. S. Perce to John Davis: Illinois Canal loan, Press Copy.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co., Magniac, Jardine & Co. Covering letters from Governor Davis and Jacob Fry on Illinois Canal affairs.
Benjamin Balch: Seeks to arrange meeting with Messrs. N.M. Rothschild & Son, Messrs. Maginac, Smith & Co. and Hon. Michael Ryan to help stabilize the Massachusetts State Stocks.
Agreement entered into by Baring Bros. & Co. acting for themselves as well as for the Bondholders with the Union Bank of Louisiana.
George Althusen: Relates his business misfortunes. Offers his services.
Statement of the Mechanics & Traders Bank of New Orleans.
Hon. J. Davis to Thomas Baring - Gives an account of the class of people he and Mr. Leavitt encountered on their Mission and their attitude towards the maintenance of the public faith of Illinois.
Abbott Lawrence to Joshua Bates - Economic conditions in Great Britain and United States compared.
R.W. Weston: Refers to business in China.
Erastus Corning: Forwards letter of R.W. Sherman of Albany City Bank relating to negotiations of E.C. Delavan for a loan.
John Hare Powell to Thomas Baring - re Pennsylvania affairs - Revenue Bill - Charter of the Borough of West Philadelphia &c.
E.J. & H.S. Lawford to Baring Bros. & Co. Opinion as to the interest due on the Union Bank of Louisiana Bonds in reply to enquiry by them.
Chas. Oakley to Baring Bros. & Co. Concerning Illinois affairs.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Enclosing copy of Memo of Governor Davis re contract between the Governor of Illinois and the subscribers to the Canal Loan. Press Copy.
J. Davis, Governor of Illinois: Need of clear and explicit contract to avoid ambiguities.
Louis McLane: Railroad matters.
No. 6 Maryland - An Act in aid of the Susquehanna Canal Company and of the Tide Water Canal Co. Enclosed in 27 April 1844.
Wm. S. Wait to John Davis: Illinois tax to pay on public debt.
The Boston Committee (Sturgis, Lawrence & Ward) to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Commenting on the Report of Governor Davis & Capt. Swift and discussing Illinois affairs generally.
Burke, Watt & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing New Orleans Price Current, Commercial Intelligencer & Merchants' Transcript.
Comparative Statement of the 6 New Orleans Specie Paying Banks from the returns made to the Board of Currency at different epochs.

Boston Committee to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac, Jardine & Co. Arrangements re Illinois Loan - Copy of letter of instructions to Governor Davis who proceeds to Illinois with Mr. Leavitt and Col. Oakley.
A. Henry & Co.: Refers to the China trade of R.P. Dana on behalf of Messrs. Howland & Aspinwall.
Lewis H. Haslewood's Circular relative to Denison's United States Bank Bond.
Samuel A. Goddard to Joshua Bates - re the American Tariff - recommends the introduction of Indian corn &c.
R.B. Forbes: Will sail with Col. Perkins in Massachusetts for Liverpool.
Abbott Lawrence to Joshua Bates - re Illinois Canal Report - Eulogy of Governor Davis.
H. Gray Jr. to J. Bates - Affairs on "Arroyo" Estate, Cuba. See also 26 September 1844.
Fred Frey to Baring Bros. & Co. Re affairs of Union Bank of Louisiana, New Orleans.
J.C. & H. Freshfield, to Magniac, Jardine & Co. Their opinion re Illinois Loan.
J. Hamilton: Cotton crop.
W.W. Bonnin: Asks for introduction to merchants in Scotland and Ireland.
D. Leavitt: Illinois and Michigan Canal.
D. Leavitt: Charges of the loan of $1,600,000 against the State of Illinois.
Memo: Arrangement with the Union Bank of Louisiana in respect to State bonds.
Frederic Gray: Business in Calcutta.
Statement of the Affairs of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
No. 5 Maryland - An additional supplement to an Act entitled "An Act to Regulate Sales by Public Auction Passed in December Session Ch. III". Enclosed in 27 April 1844.
R.W. Weston: Refers to his China business and departure from Canton.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. And Magniac, Jardine & Co. Enclosing account of disbursements for Illinois Canal.
Wm. Debuys, Treasurer State Louisiana, to Hon. Chas. Derbigny - Submitting the Annual Statement of the receipts and expenditures of the State to 31 December 1843, with comments and explanations.
D. Claude, Treasury, Annapolis to J.H.B. Latrobe, Baltimore: Charges for interest submitted to the House of Delegates.
Wm. Ropes to J. Bates - Gives full details of his business - Comments upon relations between United States & Great Britain.
F.H. Story (for T.W.W.) to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac Jardine & Co. Illinois Canal - Advising them of Reports, Maps &c. which have been forwarded to the Liverpool House. Press copy.
John Davis: Memo on the Illinois Canal loan.
Wm. B. Reid: Press copy (faded).
John Tappan: Mineral deposits, mining, iron market in St. Louis. Exploitation of Iron Mountain - iron ore deposits.
Cassius Boyer: Prince Napoleon.
D. Leavitt to Baring Bros. & Co. &c. Prospects of the Illinois & Michigan Canal Co.
R.H. Gould: Wants to cash draft on Co. Webb.
E.C. Delavan: Refund of loan from Mr. Goddard.
Michael Ryan to Messrs. Sturgis, Lawrence & Ward: Relative to report of Governor Davis of Illinois.
Jno. Brough, Auditor of the State of Ohio. Reference to a Map of Ohio.
Aug. Heard to T.W. Ward: Requests letter of credit for his business in Canton.
Nathan Hale to T.W. Ward: News about Mexican affairs.

T.P. Corbin to Mr. Bates - re Pennsylvania financial affairs - recommends the appointment of two capable citizens of the State of Harrisburg to look after the interests of the public creditor - and suggests Mr. W.B. Reed and Mr. H.D. Gilpin for the appointment.
Enoch Train: Asks $38,000 for ship Joshua Bates.
C.A. Davis: Believes Santa Anna to re-attack Texas. Texas annexation movement.
Gray & Morse: Requests Wm. Crawshay for consignment of Iron.
Jas. Freshfield, Jr.: Proposed Illinois Canal Loan.
Baring Bros. & Co. to Matthias Purton - Draft Power of Attorney to effect an arrangement with the Union Bank of Louisiana.
J. Watson Webb to Baring Bros. & Co. Re charges made against the House of Baring by George Griswold in 1840.
Jacob Little & Co.: Introduction for James S. Armstrong.
John H.B. Latrobe to Baring Bros. & Co. Outlook in Maryland following the Presidential Election.
Conditions attached to the Bill of Sale by which one half of the Ship "Joshua Bates" and appurtenances is transferred by Enoch Train to T.W. Ward.
R.M. Gibbes to J. Bates - Discusses Oregon and Texas questions and British relations generally.
Peschier & Forstall to Baring Bros. & Co. Affairs of the New Orleans Banks - enclosing New Orleans Price - Current, Commercial Intelligencer and Merchants' Transcript.
Arch. Gracie: Prospects of good cotton crop.
Copy of Letter from Mr. Stokes to T.W. Ward on the subject of Indiana finances.
Chas. Oakley to John A. Smith, London: Illinois affairs.
R.P. Dana: Refers to an arrangement with Messrs. Henry & Co.
Michael Ryan & Chas. Oakley to J.A. Smith - Illinois affairs.
J.E. Sheffield: New York and New Havan Railway Company.
J.P. Benjamin: Authority of the Union Bank of Louisiana in respect to bondholders.
Charles A. Jacobs, Union Bank of Louisiana, New Orleans: Contractual obligation to market state bonds.
Benjamin Balch to J. Bates - Enclosing sketch of a proposed Act of Congress with a plan of National Free Banking &c. See also 30 March 1844.
Fred. Frey, Cashier Union Bank of Louisiana, to Baring Bros. & Co. Transmitting Resolutions adopted by the Stock-holders of this Bank at their meeting on the 16th Instant.
J.G. Mason, U.S. Navy Department: Clauses of the Act of Congress in reference to contractors of the Naval services.
J.H. Hicks: British Government to shift purchases of hemp from Russia to the United States. Speculations in cotton.
W.H. Swift to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac, Jardine & Co. Describes in detail the proceedings with regard to the Illinois & Michigan Canal Co.
R.P. Dana: Remits 30,000 pounds and comments on Baring's business system.
Elihu Chauncey: Press copy (faded).
J. Davis, Governor of Illinois: Plans to visit Scotland and Ireland.
T.W. Ward (for the Committee) to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Enclosing letter from Governor Davis and Mr. Leavitt - also Governor Davis to T.W. Ward on Illinois affairs.
Memo American Whale Fishery.
Chas. Oakley to Gabriel Shaw - concerning the affairs of the Illinois & Michigan Canal Co. and his connection with them.
Joseph Sheffield to Baring Bros. & Co. Respecting the projected New York and New Haven Railroad Company.
Terms of Subscription to the Illinois Canal Loan 1844, raised under the authority of an Act of the Legislature of the State of Illinois passed in 1843.
John H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Ohio affairs discussed in detail.
W.H. Ogden to John A. Smith: Will attend the meeting of the Illinois Committee.
J. Curwen: Cotton crop to reach 2,500,000 bales with inferior quality and lower prices.
Certificates of Deposits in the Bank of Louisiana by the Union Bank.
John Cryder: Resigned the Presidency of the Reading Railroad Co. Political and financial news.
Unsigned and unfinished memo on the State of the Island of Cuba.
DeForest & Co.: Rumours that Brazil would take possession of the Banda Oriental thus affecting the affairs at Montevideo.
Boston Committee to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac Jardine & Co. Report of Mission of Governor Davis & Mr. Leavitt to Springfield in the interests of the Canal Loan and Illinois finances generally.
James G. Murdoch: Desires to export Madeira wine to America.
Wm. Gray: Remittances of Horace Gray's funds.
Thomas Ford to Governor Davis & D. Leavitt- The Illinois and Michigan Canal Loan and the Public Debt of Illinois treated in detail.
Boston Committee to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Enclosing copy of the draft of the Trust Deed as received from Governor Davis.
J.P. Benjamin and C. Roselins,-Their opinion re Acts affecting Property Banks.
R.W. Weston: Cargo of goods for China.
George Peabody to Baring Bros. & Co. Dissolution of the firm of Peabody, Riggs & Co. of New York & Baltimore to be succeeded by Riggs, Jenkins & Co. (S. Riggs, H.T. Jenkins & Mr. Babcock).
J.J. Dixwell to Baring Bros. & Co. Changes in the firm of Messrs. Augustine Heard & Co. of Canton.
E.C. Delavan: Wants to open a credit account in London.
E.J. & H.L. Lawford: Louisiana Loan.

T.W. Ward to Mr. Perit - Plan to influence the public sentiment of the country with regard to the Debts of the States through religious and secular publications. Press Copy. See second letter 4 January 1844. N.B. For dates of other papers on this subject see list marked Pennsylvania Correspondence 1844.
T.W. Ward to Daniel Lord - Concerning the Pennsylvania Debt.
J. Watson Webb to Baring Bros. & Co. Proposal re Barrellville Mining Co. N.B. Enclosed are several papers among them the press copy of Mr. Bates' reply.

No. 7 Maryland - An Act entitled "A Supplement to an Act to facilitate the collection of a portion of the tax levied in pursuance of the Acts passed at March Session 1841, Ch. 23" - Enclosed in 27 April 1844.
Memo re Illinois Canal Bonds.
Wm. Austin: Reviews former business activities and asks for loan of money against future consignments of cotton.
Hon. John Davis to T. Baring: Enclosing Memo re Illinois & Michigan Canal Loan.
R.J. Harvey: Skeptical about the promises of the American States to English creditors.
H.R. Kendall: Asks for agency of Wright, Portland and Co., and Robert Barbour and Brothers, Manchester: wool business.
Lemuel Shaw: Letter of introduction for Rev. Joseph B. Felt.
Arch. Gracie: Good weather for picking cotton.
1st Section of an Act amendatory of the Charter of the New Orleans Canal & Banking Co.
J. Davis: Refers to the conduct of Michael Ryan against himself in the Illinois affairs.
J. Davis, Governor of Illinois: State tax to pay interest on public debt.
J. Rodney Croskey: Wm. Hales asks for Lloyds Agency for Boston.
Isaac N. Coffin: Offer to recover debt from the U.S. Government. Also Power of Attorney.

Jno. A. Stevens, President Bank of Commerce, N.Y. to J. Bates - Re question of a "Free Bank" - that is a Bank organized under the General Banking Law of the State to draw Bills of Exchange on a blank credit.
C.A. Davis to J. Bates - Presidential election - Mr. Polk's success.
A. Gracie to J. Bates: Enclosing circular - cotton crop of the United States 1843-4.
Wm. Thompson: Illinois Affairs.
Joshua Hamm: Transfer of Texas to the United States. Payment for it to be used to liquidate the Mexican National Debt.
Memo re Pennsylvania Debt held in Great Britain. List of Foreign holders of Pennsylvania Loan having $50000 and upwards (20 April 1843.)
A. Van Sassen & Co.: Encloses statement of Profit and Loss.
Wm. Bard to John A. Smith - Illinois affairs.
George Peabody: Comments on J.J. Speed of Baltimore.
Arch. Gracie: Expects good cotton crop.
Alfred Kelley to Joshua Bates - Enclosing Annual Report of the Board of Public Works &c.
C. Stetson to J. Bates - financial standing &c. of Ohio. Encloses letter of 30 October 1844.
C.A. Davis: Political news in the United States; Presidential election. Texas Question.
Statement of the affairs of the City Bank of New Orleans.
R.M. Gibbes to J. Bates. Relations with Great Britain - Oregon question.
John H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Enclosing Maryland Acts.
A. DeLaValetta: Investment in American securities.
T.W. Ward to J.M. Coale. Concerning the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.
J. Hamm to Baring Bros. & Co. His opinion of the Texas case - Recommends the purchase of the Mexican National Debt, held in London.
J.M. Coale, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.: Refers to arrangement which was passed by the Board of directors.
D.B. Holbrook to Hon. John Davis - Information concerning Illinois affairs in view of his mission to England.
Illinois and Michigan Canal - Memo of Papers, copies of letters &c. relating to the claim of Mr. Leavitt for $40,000. Press copies.

No. 1 Maryland - A further Supplement to the Act entitled An Act for the general valuation and assessment of property in this State and to provide a Tax to pay the debts of the State passed at March Session, 1841, Ch. 23 - Enclosed in 27 April 1844.
R.W. Weston: Goes to China as agent of Messrs. Gray & Co. and Messrs. Goodhue & Co.
A. Guillemin: Prospects for sugar crop.
J. Horsley Palmer to Joshua Bates - Re European subscribers to the Illinois & Michigan Canal Loan &c.
E.C. Delavan: Asks for credit of 10,000 to 15,000 pounds.
Memo re Bonds of the State of Michigan.
Louis McLane: Relative to the financing of the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. with enclosure.
A.&S. Henry & Co.: Hudson's Bay Co. orders for blankets. Encloses list of the Directors of the H.B. Co.
No. 4 Maryland - An Act relating to the collection of State Taxes. Enclosed in 27 April 1844.
Gov. John Davis to Lawrence & Sturgis: Press copies of correspondence (badly faded).
J. Watson Webb: Encloses paper pertaining to his business (missing),
Boston Committee to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Enclosing correspondence in relation to Illinois matters.
George Peabody to C.C. Tiffany, Baltimore: Maryland credit.
A.&M. Heine to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing printed Circular - Annual Statement of the New Orleans Price Current, Commercial Intelligencer and Merchant's Transcript.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward: Press copies including letter to J.M. Coale, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. of 21 October 1843:
Duncan & R. Radcliffe: Bonds of the Richmond and Petersburg Railroad Co., and the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad.Co.
W. Thompson to John A. Smith: His partner is out of town and cannot decide on Illinois matters.
Chas. Stetson: Ohio State securities.
Arch. Gracie: Prospects of cotton crop.
R.B. Forbes: Ship Paul Jones ready to take on cargo for China.
Statement of the Affairs of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. - and Magniac, Jardine & Co. Enclosing account of disbursements made for Illinois Canal.
Horace Gray, Jr.: Arroyo Estate, Cuba.
P. Perit: Refers to the contents of medicinal extracts.
Wm. C. Johnson to Baring Bros. & Co. On the subject of the present condition of Maryland - its public credit &c.
J. Davis: Illinois affairs.

F.H. Elmore, President Bank of the State of S. Carolina to Baring Bros. & Co. Re possibility that the affairs of the Bank may be wound up by the Legislature and the funds applied to pay off the public debt.
J. Hamilton: Cotton Crop.
W.H. Swift: Illinois and Michigan Canal.
New Orleans Canal Bank: Statement of assets and liabilities.
Arch. Gracie: Frost did not damage the crop severely.
Enoch Train: Plans to establish a ship line from Boston to Liverpool.
Union Bank of Louisiana Bond form.
R.D. Shepherd to T.W. Ward: Refers to the Governor's message, which he encloses.
D. Leavitt to Thomas Ford, Governor of Illinois: Illinois & Michigan Canal.
Denison's United States Bank Debentures.
J.M. Coale, President Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. to T.W. Ward - Re a Loan for the completion of the Canal.
R.B. Forbes: Shipment of goods.
F.H. Delano: Sends pamphlets "Old World and the New" and "Fanny".
Horace Gray, Jr.: Question of salary and expenses.
Comparative Situation of the Consolidated Association.
DeConinck Spalding & Co.; Urged Messrs. George Knight & Co. to transfer the Arroyo Estate.
List of new correspondents with numbers attached.
J.M. Coale, President Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Re Loan for Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.
D. Claude, Treasurer, Annapolis, Maryland: Relating to payments of interest on public debt.
J.H.B. Latrobe to ______ Carey - Maryland financial affair.

Jas. Freshfield, Jr. to John A. Smith M.P. Enclosing opinion of Mr. Roundell Palmer with regard to the proposed contract and Trust Deed, prepared by Governor Ford, for the Illinois & Michigan Canal Loan.
J.L. Prevost: Agrees to take up 18 debentures.
R.M. Gibbes: Illinois State bonds.
Chas. Augustus Davis to J .Bates. Re aid from General Government to defaulting States.
Report of the Committee on Finance of the State of Louisiana.
Baring Bros. & Co. to Edmund Forstall - Re Bonds of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
C.A. Davis: Refers to law suit and other business matters.
H. Wheaton: Senate rejected his commercial treaty with the Lollverein; Question of Tariff.
Statement of the affairs of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
Clark & Carpenter to T.W. Ward - Re negotiation between the House of Baring and the Republic of New Grenada, re building a Canal across the Isthmus at Panama.

No. 2 Maryland. A supplement to the Act entitled An Act to raise additional revenue to aid in paying the debts of the State by laying a tax on Salaries, Incomes, Emoluments and Profits, passed at December Session 1841 Ch. 325 - Enclosed in 27 April 1844.
Baring Brothers to Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana: Action against ship Royal Albert.
T.W. Ward (for the Committee) to Baring Bros & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Covering several letters relating to Illinois matters.
Geo. Peabody to H.W. Evans. Re Maryland credit. Press Copy.

Frederick Frey, Cashier Union Bank, Louisiana, to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing Report of the Committee to whom was referred the letter of E.J. Forstall, Agent of Baring Bros. & Co. Proposing a settlement for the 1750000 of State Bonds in favour of the Union Bank of Louisiana, due in November.
W.H. Swift to Boston Committee - Illinois & Michigan Canal Co. Subscriptions to Loan &c.
Jacob Little & Co.: Mr. Gabriel Mead. Bank of Liverpool may have received forged bank notes.
W.H Swift to Wm. Sturgis - The Illinois & Michigan Canal.
O.A. Norris: Sends drawings of eight-wheel locomotive (missing). Encloses letter from Mr. Masui to Wm. Norris pertaining to the subject.
T.W. Ward (for Boston Committee) to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac, Jardine & Co. Covering a letter from Mr. Arthur Bronson on the subject of the Illinois Canal and Trustees.
Sam J. Peters, Union Bank of Louisiana: Resolution relating to payment of bonds.
Hon. John Davis & D. Leavitt to Magniac Jardine & Baring Bros. & Co. The Public Debt of Illinois and the attitude of the people discussed confidentially.
Statement and valuation of the Assets of the New Orleans Canal and Banking Co. Press copy.
Joshua Hamm: Demand for the Mexican National Debentures. Recommends purchase.
Extract from the New York Herald re American State Stocks and the Money-dealers.
No. 3 Maryland - An Act to tax the commissions of certain officers of this State. Enclosed in 27 April 1844.
Thomas Ford to T.W. Ward: No expenses can be paid until authorized by the Legislature.
